citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
On January 21, 2025, The Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) was informed that expired Ketamine
(expired April 2024) had been administered to 12 rabbits under an approved protocol between May 2024 and January
2025 for survival surgeries, imaging, and blood collection procedures. The 12 rabbits were monitored by the facility lab
during the procedures and post-operatively with no reported adverse effects. A clinical veterinarian of the facility stated
once the Principal Investigator (PI) of the lab was contacted, corrective action was immediately implemented to ensure
proper handling of the expired drug. The potency and efficacy of medications may be affected once they expire, which
may be harmful to the animals.
Each research facility shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of
appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries.
To be corrected from this day forward, September 22, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.33(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
On January 21, 2025, The Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) was informed that expired Ketamine 
(expired April 2024) had been administered to 12 rabbits under an approved protocol between May 2024 and January 
2025 for survival surgeries, imaging, and blood collection procedures. The 12 rabbits were monitored by the facility lab 
during the procedures and post-operatively with no reported adverse effects. A clinical veterinarian of the facility stated 
once the Principal Investigator (PI) of the lab was contacted, corrective action was immediately implemented to ensure 
proper handling of the expired drug. The potency and efficacy of medications may be affected once they expire, which 
may be harmful to the animals.  
Each research facility shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of 
appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. 
To be corrected from this day forward, September 22, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
